article_title: Is OSHA About To Ramp Up Its Whistleblower Program?
article_text:
Is OSHA About To Ramp Up Its Whistleblower Program?

Law360, New York (January 23, 2015, 1:11 PM ET) -- Employee whistleblowing and retaliation claims are on the rise and the stakes are high as the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration ramps up its whistleblower program. OSHA’s whistleblower protection program covers 22 federal statutes, including the Affordable Care Act, Sarbanes-Oxley and a myriad of transportation, environmental, consumer product and other safety statutes. Each year more whistleblower complaints are filed with OSHA and employers can expect this trend to continue.

article_metadata.description: The U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration is exploring additional ways to increase damage awards from its whistleblower program given its recent announcement that it plans to lower the investigatory standard for cases from a preponderance of the evidence to reasonable cause. If it does, employers can expect OSHA investigators to find more cases meritorious and push for more monetary settlements, says Debra Friedman of Cozen O'Connor PC.
